verses.roman:
sahasra-vadane yabe kahaye 'ananta'
eka-dinera līlāra tabu nāhi pāya anta

synonyms: sahasra-vadane—in thousands of mouths; yabe—when; kahaye—says; ananta—Lord Ananta; eka-dinera—of one day; līlāra—of pastimes; tabu—still; nāhi—does not; pāya—reach; anta—the limit.
translation: If Ananta, with His one thousand hoods, tried to describe even one day's pastimes of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, He would find them impossible to describe fully.
